server.title: Server
server.description: Server headers show information about the software used to provide the website. Show software's version it's a lot information to give to attackers.

set-cookie.title: Cookie not HTTP Only
set-cookie.description: Using the flag 'HttpOnly' the cookie won't be read from JavaScript only sent by HTTP

set-cookie.title: Cookie not over SSL/TLS
set-cookie.description: Using the flag 'Secure' the cookie will be sent only in HTTPS traffic avoiding MITM read its content

set-cookie.title: Cookie not only from SameSite
set-cookie.description: Samesite cookies tells to browser send the cookie only in requests initiated from the same domain. It avoid CSRF attacks

referrer-policy.title: Referrer-Policy with bad practices
referrer-policy.description: This site use unsafe-url in Referrer-Policy header. Because of this browsers will always send the full URL in any request to any origin

x-permitted-cross-domain-policies.title: X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies too open
x-permitted-cross-domain-policies.description: The most secure option to X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies is none, make sure you really need other option

strict-transport-security.title: HSTS without includeSubDomains
strict-transport-security.description: It's recommended protect all the subdomains using HTTPS as well

strict-transport-security.title: HSTS without preload
strict-transport-security.description: It's much better secure configure the domain under HSTS preload list in the browser

access-control-allow-origin.title: Access-Control-Allow-Origin too open
access-control-allow-origin.description: Using Access-Control-Allow-Origin with option '*' are too open because any website can request the content

public-key-pins.title: Public-Key-Pins without a backup key
public-key-pins.description: Using Public-Key-Pins with only one key is dangerous because if you lost your key (CA hacked, renew...) the user can't access the site with the new key once the browser will not accept that

content-security-policy.title: Content-Security-Policy too permisive
content-security-policy.description: Using 'unsafe-inline' reduces the effectiveness of CSP, prefer using Nonce or Hash
